New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest goalscorer in Euros history with a goal 33 seconds after his penalty miss.
Mattia Zaccagni scored his first goal for Italy in the 98th minute, the second-latest goal in Euros history (behind Hungary's Kevin Csoboth).
Key Match Events: Mattia Zaccagni's 98th-minute goal broke Croatian hearts and sent Italy through.
Luka Modric scored after a saved penalty, redeeming himself 33 seconds later.
Croatia failed to win any of their group games at Euros for the second time, after 2004.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric hinted at retiring from international football after the tournament.
Italy ended a run of 281 minutes without a Euros goal with Zaccagni's strike.
Croatia's penalty miss streak continued with Modric's miss and subsequent goal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Each of the last four meetings between Croatia and Italy ended in a draw.
Italy's goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma has saved four of his last seven penalties in Euros.
Others: The first half was tight and cautious with limited chances.
Croatia had more possession but struggled to convert chances.
